title: add native fuse fs for local backend
body:
i propose that there should be a fuse fs that offers accesss to data stored using the local backend.

underlying problem: when running owncloud on a relatively slow machine, e.g., an arm-based nas, using webdav for (local or remote) file access is incredibly slow - very large files become pretty much inaccessible. however, when using the local storage backend, all files are already present on the local harddrive, just not directly visible. when only using sync to keep several machines in sync, you don't notice the slowness as this is a background task.

i therefore propose that there should be a fuse file system that makes the files available on local storage accessible as a local fs. i believe that this fuse fs will have to get file ownership and access rights from the database but can pass calls to the actual file data through to the underlying os. an added benefit would be that the fuse-mounted owncloud data can be reexported via samba or nfs, thus also speeding up remote access.

while having a fully-featured fs that allows both read and write access, can import mapped folders from the owncloud configuration and show data from other remote storage backends would be uber-cool, a minimal fs that allows read-only access to locally stored data will probably solve most use cases.
